p: We used NCEP/CFSR products 38 on a T382 Gaussian grid (resolution of ∼0.312° × ∼0.312°) to simulate current climate conditions (1979–2010; Supplementary Figs 2–6 and Supplementary Tables 6–7). Specifically, we extracted daily maximum and minimum temperature (2 m above ground) and precipitation from the 6-hourly data sets (ds093.0 and ds093.1 (ref. 48)). We also extracted relative humidity (2 m above ground), u- and v-wind speed components (10 m above ground), and total cloud cover, which we converted to sky cover via sunshine per cent 49 from the monthly data set (ds093.2 (ref. 48)) and calculated mean monthly values.
